summary: This document appears to be a prison administrative record noting an error in log-keeping procedures. Staff used the wrong log book (I/M companion log) instead of the required Staff Suicide Watch log for monitoring an inmate. The error was discovered and corrected by creating a second, proper log with identical entries.

events.title: Log-Keeping Error Discovered and Corrected
events.description: Staff assigned to monitor an inmate used the incorrect log book (I/M companion log) instead of the required Staff Suicide Watch log. The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was completed with identical entries.

locations.name: MCC New York
locations.context: Metropolitan Correctional Center, a federal detention facility where the log-keeping incident occurred.

keyFacts: A procedural error occurred where prison staff used an 'I/M companion log' instead of the required 'Staff Suicide Watch log' for monitoring an inmate.
The error was discovered, and a second, correct log was created with entries identical to the first.
The incident took place at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
